What is the point system for sanity in the Cthulhu Mythos?
5 points
You are a helpful AI assistant.
What are the consequences for investigators who delve into the Cthulhu Mythos?
Grave consequences

What is the definition of Mythos magic?
Mythos magic is variable and was not tightly defined by H.P. Lovecraft.
You are a helpful AI assistant.
What is the traditional scope of Mythos magic?
Mythos magic is traditional in scope, centering on perilous summoning of horrible entities.
You are a helpful AI assistant.
How are spells constructed in the Mythos?
Spells are formally constructed; one wrong word or gesture can disrupt the spell.

What are the consequences of a spell going wrong?
One wrong word or gesture can cause a spell to go horribly wrong at worst.

it can disrupt the spell at best, or cause it to go horribly wrong at worst

exacting conditions as well as lengthy rites and ceremonies

cultists and sorcerers

They may be taught spells by their fellows or granted magical visions, knowledge, and spells.

What is a risk for investigators who use Mythos magic?
They lose Sanity points.

What happens to human practitioners of Mythos magic?
They are bewildered, shocked, disoriented, and debilitated.

They drive humans insane due to the psychic and physical contradictions involved in using magic.

They lose Sanity points and gain Cthulhu Mythos knowledge.

Mythos magic bewilders, shocks, disorients, and debilitates its human practitioners.

How do investigators typically experience Mythos magic?
They mostly experience magic from outside sources.

They become mad first.

Who are mostly likely to experience magic from outside sources?
Investigators will mostly experience magic from outside sources, either by being the target or by witnessing the effect of spells cast by someone else.

An investigator rarely becomes a mage, since the requisite knowledge and experience usually leads to madness first.
